comments.body: This posts really need more votes. Iâ€™d love to see path blocks for the new nylium!
I guess we would also need mycelium and pozole equivalents. You could also extend this to sand and red sand. I just think that that would be a nice touch.
This really is a good idea especially for the builders.

I like the idea, but how exactly would we get the path blocks. this isn't regular dirt blocks, so I don't think we would be able to use shovels to create paths in the nether. As far as sand goes, we do have sandstone, but the top texture could be tweaked a bit to distinguish between path and sand.
we already have nylium
I would probably just stick with an enchanted diamond sword.

Finally! Maybe with this pvp 1v1 matches won't last an entire half hour cause of both players overpowered armor. Using the mace would be risky, cause of how slow it could be, but with skill it could turn the tide of a battle. Love this idea! Voted!

Firstly, while the idea of the Gate Keeper doesn't particularly grab me (I have nothing against it, its just not my thing), the idea of adding a mace to the game is a brilliant idea! Already in Minecraft there is some work towards creating a more diverse arsenal (axe damage to shields, the trident), and a mace would be an amazing addition to that. Perhaps it should have its own enchantments, such as crushing (same effect as sharpness) and armour breaker (increases % of damage done to armour). They should also do more damage to skeletons/wither skeletons (and maybe the wither) as a mace would be more effective than a sword.

Also, I have just posted (assuming it gets approved) my own idea for a new weapon, the twinblade, but under the idea of having more new weapons, so as such I have included a link to this post. If you object to this I can remove it, but I thought, as I would like to see new weapons included in the game, that a link was entirely appropriate.

I like the mace. What I don't like is the gate keeper. He is not a fleshed out boss like either the Wither, Enderdragon, or Elder Guardian. The boss we need has to have a little more substance before I give my support.

I like your idea a lot, but there's a little bit of tweaking needed.  I'm assuming the Gatekeeper mini boss is by itself in a different category.  Assuming Shield Breaker is a rare item does it start off enchanted with something?  People are going to be upset if maces can break armor.  Imagine grinding xp and enchanting to just lose your full diamond armor with Protection, Feather Falling, Mending, Unbreaking and so on.  You'd be heart-broken, I think it should damage the player, either more than a trident/diamond sword or have an enchantment that reduces protection %.  The cost would be that it's slower, but it does more criticals.

Iâ€™ve seen the feedback everyoneâ€™s been giving. I want to thank you. I plan on reading over the posts I made last year and see what needs tweaking. It appears not everyone is too fond of the mini boss. Iâ€™m completely open to suggestions to improving it.

Thank you all again for your feedback,
TheMcExplorer

I like the armor damage idea althrough i'll suggest this as a new item that damage more the armor than the own user as you said.

It could be pretty good item and i recommend something:

Why not make this a item/tool that can be crafted.

X=Nothing
M=Material
S=Stick
M M M
M S M
X S X

Now the name shield breaker sounds cool but Armor Breaker sounds cooler for a mace althrough shield breaker sounds more to an possible enchantment for the mace

Some utilities that it can do (Example: Wood)
+3 Damage (+1 per material level)
+0.5 Knockback ( +0.5 per material level)
+1 Damage to durability (+0.5 per material level)
All of these can increase with the quality of the material stated on the ().
Slow Cooldown between hits.
Can break type stone block on one shot but instead of giving the block it gives a piece of the stone with a triangular shape that has some uses like creating a new arrow or used as an proyectile to the dispenser.
If it is a ore block type it simply works like a slower version of the pickaxe.
Now your Armor breaker would be one wich has a difference from the netherite one (if included) it would do the same damage as a trident with their bonus making this a very strong weapon if you find it.
This could be crafted from a stick, the new chain block, and an iron ingot.

No shattering diamond that would make mining for days to get diamond useless instead it should be severely damaged when it hits diamond and does 4 hearts of damage to the player but it does normal damage to the armor or  they are an artifact dropped from zombies that could be added to diamond armor to make it mace resistant but I don't want to waste days of mining for diamonds at y coordinate 12!!!!!!!
Axes already counter shields.
I like the idea, but maybe no gatekeeper.
It seems to have been added on 1.21.
Released!
Mojang probably wouldn't implement this for one of the same reasons that they won't implement guns. The player wouldn't be able to see and dodge the shots.

It would do good for it's uselessness. :o

like why would I want to make my enemy invisible?

This is a useful substitute for its expensive crafting
Sounds like a silly problem to have... I wouldnâ€™t agree with this change. Maybe use TNT to clear out space?

MacchuPicchu96  ,would you like to use stacks and stacks of tnt to explore a mine?, with the chance that the tnt destroy the ores, the slow that it would be, and the destruction it would cause....etc.
Of course not, TNT isn't a great solution. But honestly... throwing out blocks takes mere seconds of your time and is a total nonissue imho.

I think having to decide what to do with the blocks is part of mining.  Personally, I save them.  I would rather take the time to save them than to have to mine them as needed later.  But it's also not that much work to throw them away to despawn or even throw them in lava.  If you don't want to do that level of work, fill your inventory with the empty stacks of the blocks that you want to keep so that they will fill as you go along.
yes plz! and make the hammers usable as a weapon!

I believe it should mine a 3x3 area. I know this is completely contrary to your point. To the extent of actually making the problem you proposed worse but I feel the hammer should be a more powerful mining tool.

Perhaps the ability to disintegrate blocks could be an enchantment? It should also have access to a higher tier of knockback. Just a thought.

Absolutely love the idea! you have my vote!
Yes
Yes please.Also make it work like them explorer said as well.

It would be nice if you could also put an enchanted book that has multiple enchantments in the table and move an enchantment to a different book.

For example, I found an awesome enchanted book in a chest, but it has both Protection IV and Sharpness IV.  I can use this table to put the Sharpness IV enchantment on a different book so I can make use of both of them.

I would say it should use more than experience to do the disenchanting.  Maybe lapis, maybe another valuable material like nether quartz.
They've added the Grindstone now my friend. I'm sorry that it's not like your idea completely though. I want to choose my own enchantments. :(
This is a cool idea. It would be great if we could move enchantments off tools to fresh unused books and the other way around: when you use an enchantment you get a fresh book
It would pretty useless now that 1.14 was released.
basically is in 1.14 at grindstone.
Grindstones are great but they don't let you keep the enchantment. This needs to be added.
make enchanted books to enchant your tools and get what you want.

I have wanted this for a long time. It would revolutionize enchanting. Iâ€™m tired of fishing and catching a bow with mending when I already have a bow with mending. If I could put the enchantment onto a book it would make me extremely happy. But now, I have to continuously fish until I get a book with mending which can take a very long time.

Please implement this. I have seen it in tutorials in older versions of the game. Its really upsetting not having it available in the most recent patching of this game. Cmon and please implement this function to take enchantments off weapons and copy them into unused books.
I think this idea is really cool as well, but picking out specific enchantments would be too op, in my opinion
I had the same idea! I even thought about the villager part too. I just went on suggestions to see if anyone already posted it ðŸ˜Š.

I was just about to make the same post. This would honestly be an amazing thing to implement in the game. It would make it so much easier to make stairs, slabs and fences without having any extras afterwards.
Yeah it could be used cheaply get fences, stairs, wood blocks, etc.
what if you had to put a certain amount of wood for the doors like two pieces of wood?

Legit was gonna post this! I would say the same crafting materials to make it but instead of stone it would be like 1 iron ingot and 3 logs of any kind! Then you can click into it and it acts like the Stonecutter but for wood, making it so much useful than using a crafting bench. Definitely an idea I want inside the game and we should all vote for it to get seen so it can be inside the game!
Great idea! Would love to see a new villager, and a way to get wood blocks more cheap and efficiently.

Repairing a bow with one string is cheaper than the crafting recipe so it should cost at minimum 3 string. Also, why is this needed? You can already repair bows with freshly crafted bows, Do you really want those 3 sticks back?

@KhaledTheGamer3
Its an anvil repairing, each string would repair 25% like other materials. Its for consistency as everything else has a repair material in Anvil.
This should use the fletching table!!!!!

String makes the most sense. The amount of string needed to repair can scale (similarly to the exp needed) the more it's been repaired. It's like you're wrapping cloth around the wood to keep it together until it simply can't be fixed anymore.
I was thinkin warped berries with effects but thats cool too

This is actually really clever! I like the idea that it could give you a very small status boost like 10 seconds of fire res but also a cool down like the chorus fruits (but obviously longer so itâ€™s not overpowered)
This post inspired me, so I made a quick resource pack with a possible texture for both the block and the food item.
Plant it on soul soil!
I think that if it was in a warped area, where everything is flipped on it's head (vines that hang upwards), that they should grow on the ceiling. It would be nice to see upside-down farms.
It should be able to grow on both warped nylium AND soul soul!

Well, beans are edible in a large variety of ways and are used in a large variety of dishes across the world. Also it would add a new kind of crop, which Minecraft could use a few more of, so why not?
I think this is a great idea! How about adding garbanzo beans, which could be used to make hummus? I hope this idea gets considered!
i think this is a amazing idea! i hope they add it to the game.
R u ok
are you ok  gulp
I want black beans they are yummy

I think the glowing elytras would be cool and the glowing banners would be useful. However, I donâ€™t really see the point of the bed glowing,

I love this! Maybe Glowstone could give a golden color, but you could also use prismarine for a white/blue or redstone for, well, red.

very cool idea! You could see where you teammates are in a night-time game if their elytras had infused patterns on them, and the enemy team would not be able to see it as you can only see the pattern from behind.
Or we can use the glowsquid drop, Glow Ink Sac. It won't emit light, but will glow in the dark.

Also I think you should be able to charge the axe by holding down the attack button like charging a bow or charging a trident. Charging the axe does a lot more damage and charged shots should increase the drop rate of mob heads. i was just thinking of this bechause i love axe pvp but swords just destroy them so why not make a battle axe with more dammage then an axe and the same attack speed

there could be 2 axes, the regular axes is faster at cutting trees and is slower in battle while the battle axes are slower at tree cutting, it's faster than an axe but not faster than a sword and not more than a sword. it's double-sided, and it can be thrown, dose more damage to the wooden shield and wooden tools, it can also prevent knockback but they're a little cooldown, also the axe can get stuck in enemy shields unless you can give it loyalty like thor hammer or trident. you can also give it channelling so u can be thor lol. also trident would be more relied on for the riptide for flying so it doesn't make them obsolete.

I completely dissagree, because this literally makes no sense
It would work like turtle shells, but should have different names (ie. sea dweller's armor, fire eater's armor, prismarine armor, etc.)
Instead you should be able to enchant a helmet with a new enchantment book called water breathing

Ummmâ€¦.. Okay, but it doesn't make any sense

Is it a helmet made of water that blocks water so you can breathe

and is the lava just a helm made of lava that blocks lava, wouldn't that just burn you?
only in Minecraft Dungeons that kind of armor
No. Just no
This odea makes no sense at all
I think you could add Emerald armor and ruby armor. I like the idea of emerald armor because it serves another purpose of emeralds. And rubies would be cool to add
This doesn't make sense. You try turning liquid into armor. I know Minecraft is a fantasy game, but this goes beyond the limits of artistic license.

So it's not made of water or lava, but it does protect you from it. Sure, this would work well and it would be balanced. The water armor should look like the Zora armor from Legends of Zelda, but still be unique for the Minecraft world.
The water armor would be crafted with water buckets.

If you're playing in peaceful, you shouldn't expect to be able to get everything needed to beat the game.

Candles simply won't shine light until they're burned.

Yes it is only fair that those who desire to play only in Peaceful mode should be able to get the items required to finish the game, albeit just so much harder but yet accessible.

For those who do not like violence (Enough of it in today's world) but who love the creativity in Minecraft should also be able to enjoy the game to the full. I know that Minetest offers that by default but does not possess the flavor that Mine craft offers.

Having Mine craft the way it is now is like having a puzzle with a few pieces missing (A broken toy) and that is simply not fun whatsoever!

I suggest a version of Minecraft that is peaceful to todays world standards without violent humans (as there should not be). BUT it should have dangerous animals in their rightful places to give the worlds a more realistic flavor.

This world is indeed getting dangerous as each day passes would it not be nice that people did have a happy place to go without with out having to unnecessarily kill  something to achieve it?

I doubt that there is anybody who will listen to this, but anyway...
My kid (as a lot do) loves Minecraft but I will only let him play peaceful mode. He loves looking for things so he can craft new stuff and he is now stuck on the ender chest.

It would be great for peaceful players to have full access to the game. Currently there is so much of the game tied to one hostile mob and its drops which are not accessible to a whole group of players/a play style. Potions, fuel sources, achievements, ender chests, the End itself (and therefore End-related blocks - end stone, chorus plants and their drops, end rods, shulker boxes, dragon's breath, elytra). It would be wonderful to have some way to access that whole section of the game without needing to use a set seed (with a filled End portal) to access the End. :)

I would love to see this problem solved. There is so much you can do with blaze rods and blaze powders that it sucks that there is only one way to get it, and that is by killing Blazes which is a hostile mob. And Peaceful Difficulty gets rid of Hostile Mobs. It is like the one key that you can't find to unlock a new level. I love being very creative in Minecraft and I don't mind surviving and thriving but I don't like to hear another sound of a Creeper exploding near me.

The best way to solve this would pretty much have it as loot in Nether Fortresses' chests. That is the most simplest fix by simply adding in Blaze Rods to the loot tables. Nether Fortresses are usually pretty hard to find and would require you to travel hundreds and thousands of blocks in the dangerous Nether Dimension. Of course you are in Peaceful Difficulty, so you won't get squashed by Magma Cubes or get yeeted by Piglin Brutes and Ghasts, but it is still SUPER dangerous when you have large lava oceans to journey across unless you have a lovely Strider. Another suggestion also to make Slimeballs a bit easier to obtain and the most obvious is put a chest in Witch Huts.

The MOST important thing is to make Blaze Rods easy to obtain for players playing in Peaceful Difficulty. Mojang, please add Blaze Rods in Nether Fortresses' as one of the items in Chests.

I enjoy playing on peaceful when I am building and exploring. I switch modes when needed. For blaze rods I plan on going to the nether in peaceful finding a blaze spawner and surrounding it with blast resistant blocks with a small opening I can shoot through. Then when I have enough blaze rods I'll save and quit and switch back to peaceful. My goal though is to be able to get good enough at pve that I can hold my own in the nether.
I need this! I love playing on peaceful mode. Itâ€™s terrible that all because I play on peaceful I canâ€™t beat the game without cheats. Please add this Mojang!

Here's a third option. Perhaps Blazes could become Nuetral mobs in Peaceful, like the Enderman, Hoglin, etc. This eliminates the need to put them in loot chests, and still provides a challenge for those who intend on beating the game in peaceful.

I don't have access to my computer most of the time, so I often play on Pocket. The deal with pocket, however, is that it is often difficult to fight mobs, especially in the Nether. Making the Blaze neutral in Peaceful would allow for both:
1. Players on pocket to enjoy the game more without being scared of dying every couple seconds due to a smudge or water drop on the screen
2. Players who are locked to playing in peaceful (parental rules, personal choice, etc.) to complete the game

No matter what way it is done, blaze rods need to be obtainable in peaceful.
I agree. The only things I want that I can't get in the game without killing a mob are blaze rods or blaze powder. There should be some way to obtain them without resorting to killing mobs.

I know this is an old comment, but Mojang please, please add blaze powder to peaceful mode, either as something to find in looted chests or something or by turning the Blaze mobs neutral.  I may be a grown up but I really don't like hostile mobs (the noises, the jump scare when they come out of the dark) and I'm sure there are a lot of kids (and maybe some adults!) who feel the same and therefore prefer to play on peaceful mode.

I would just like to be able to make my own brewing stand and brew potions with blaze powder without needing to activate hostile mobs in my game!  I feel like I'm being left out of this one activity because I find hostile mobs too distressing to encounter.
Love this idea, Mojang should 100 percent add it.
Make a mirror in Minecraft with a reflection

There should be an option for a shiny Block like a mirror Made from Tinted Glass And Amethest

The reason to back Me Up is that theres only one way to see you and that is Third person and it gets annoying going back and forth also, when combined with a specail mod that lets you wear two sets of armour with one as the looks and one for, well armor so you would want to look at your self so Please Add Mirrors or a mirror like block
I suggest adding silver and putting the silver in the up, down, right, and left of the crafting grid with glass in the middle
You could do so much with mirrors, it could make a room feel bigger

I think the mirror block should be in the same dimensions as a banner, with the same effect of being able to be placed on top of blocks or on the sides of them.

Mirrors could also receive exclusive enchantments that allow for interesting gameplay like teleportation, revealing invisible players and mobs, and inflicting harmful or beneficial effects on players and mobs within the mirror's reach. Maybe for the teleportation enchantment, the player who enchanted it can link it to another mirror (or other mirrors) so that as soon as you step through the enchanted mirror, you surface out of the mirror it is linked to. (Or, if the mirror is liked to multiple others, the player would enter a small in-between area that has 1X2 spaces through which you can see the areas in front of the linked mirrors. Walking through one of these spaces would land you in front of the corresponding mirror.)

I don't think adding silver to the game for the sole purpose of using it to craft mirrors is necessary. However, I like the idea of giving Amethyst another use. How about this for a crafting recipe:

Glass / Amethyst Shard / Empty

Glass / Amethyst Shard / Empty

Glass / Amethyst Shard / Empty

If y'all like my ideas about the enchantments, feel free to post more ideas for them, I'd sure appreciate the help.
Enderdragon must have more health
MIRRORS, PLEASE
its a need.
I so hope they can come in the game

Ya'll Have my vote(s)!!

:D
Yeah

It wouldnt work very well people wouldnt be able to tell the difference between blocks and would remove the aspect of having to make differnt colored blocks for your builds you could just paint wood cyan and it would like like cyan concrete and nobody would now its wood until they see how long it takes the break the block.
i think this is a great idea because you could have wood on one side of the wall and a nice colour on the other side

It would be nice to be able to paint the inside of a wall of a house and not have it be the same on the outside.  Or paint the outside if you have the color of the inside.  Certain blocks could be painted like wood, concrete or stone, but not dirt, sand, concrete powder, etc. 

Painting blocks would also eliminate the need for vertical/standing/upright slabs as others have requested.  This would solve that desire on some level.

The look of the block wouldn't change, just the color of it.  If you know how to tell the difference between wood, stone and concrete then the pattern would still be present.

May I add: I think that the paint eventually begins to wear off after a period of time--rain can speed this up, but this can be prevented by waxing the paint like copper in 1.17. Paint can be stored in a cauldron, and a new brush item can be made
Thank you lord
I think we should use dye in a cauldron then use a bucket to remove the paint from the cauldron the we could use it on our walls and floors

I think either paint or wallpaper would be really nice, it could be made with dye, perhaps similar to banners?? But sometimes in a build it just doesn't work very well to have every wall be 2 blocks wide just so I can have some creative license with making different rooms different colours!!

I agree, they could be crafted from certain dyes and/or minerals :] I had wanted to craft my house in Minecraft, but then I realized the interior and exterior are two different colors, and I donâ€™t want to make 2 block thick walls :T
a good idea would be to make panel blocks instead of paint so the scavenging for resources aspect isn't lost but paint sounds lovely tbh

Lets say I wanted to use white concrete on the outside of my house but I wanted a warmer feel on the inside. Iâ€™d say we could further expand the use of dye, iron buckets, etc etc to create paint buckets so we can paint the interior of the house. Like vines except you are able to place a block against it and it wonâ€™t break. Itâ€™ll just be one (or more) sides of a block with a certain color of paint! You could even use wheat or shear horses for paint brushes!

To avoid taking up block space on the painted wall, have a tool to scrape the block wanted to be painted, then paint over that scraped block. New textures could be added by scraping and painting so it would not look like the original block. Could also incorporate different patterns (like the glazed terracotta) with different colors or combinations of colours(like adding stained glass to beacons)? Not sure if that messes with paint not using a different block?
Exactly what I was thinking, so glad Iâ€™m not the only one who though about it!
This is a must

The crafting recipe needs wax, a piece of string to act as the wick, and the fuel which is mixed into the wax. In this case soul sand should be the fuel seeing as it burns blue and burns well.
Normally an oil or oily substance is best for candle fuel, but soul sand is much better about smoke than say netherite. For ordinary candles I would recommend using a new item made from meat called fat for fuel.
I thought of the exact same thing itâ€™s a good idea
Would this mean old candles would be changed too? If so it would make gathering the items more annoying.
We need these to replace the normal ones in the Ancient Cities!!!

This is a good idea though i think you should have to have looting II to get it maybe skulk scales should be a thing to make like a turtle helmet except it is like a warden and it gives you a notification on were vibrations are coming from
Perhaps it could highlight moving mobs or objects, even if they are behind walls or other things.
I want a warden heart trophy; giving it a redstone signal would play an ominous heartbeat sound and cause nearby lights to flicker.
Since it wonâ€™t drop any type of loot that we know of I think it should drop their heads
The Warden isn't supposed to be fought, it is supposed to be avoided. The reward comes from avoiding it to be able to get the loot it is guarding
I 100% agree! It would be a really cool trophy
bro yes this is what im saying id love to hang this on my wall in my hardcore world just to say yeah i killed the warden how about you
I think we should get this, cause itâ€™s not a powerful item, not a huge incentive to kill it, not a requirement to become powerful, but just a trophy for the crazy players.
How many more brain dead people do I have to tell you're not supposed to be rewarded for killing the warden learn how to hear are you deaf are you brain dead cuz I think you are
Not really. The Warden is meant to not be fought. But a Warden head could be loot for the ancient cities.
If you had it where a key is required, this would be perfect for adventure maps.
Yes! I would finally be able to keep all my valuables safe!
Could it be broken though becasue thatâ€™s broken if you can have a locked chest. It would need balancing
It can work like a shulker box, so if you break it all of the contents will still be inside
FoggyVoice34302 That is what I was thinking
It should only be able to get destroued by the person who crafted it
so cool

I think that when mined with an iron pickaxe or better, it drops itself with its contents inside. Otherwise it is indestructible. It would also be really cool to add it to some generated structure, where you have to separately find the box and the key (or maybe passcode?) to unlock it, so it could contain really good loot. 

Maybe villages could have one, and the villagers would trade you the key as a master level trade.

I like your idea, but I think that you should ditch the idea about â€œonly the owner can access the chestâ€. I think there should be locks and keys made of iron or maybe copper, and it didnâ€™t depend on the player, just if you had it or not.

A key could be linked to a certain chest. You could have a key item but not have it assigned to a chest. The locked chest will accustom to the key.

If you ever lost the key for the locked chest, you could try prying it open with weapons, and this could consume durability.
Perhaps everyone can get into it IF they had a key or password for it. Otherwise, having it completely locked out to others may make it a bit less fun and too similar to an end chest.
Lol I literally was just thinking the same idea.
I think would be better if you use a invisible potion in the recipe of the item frame and it becomes a always invisible item frame.

I fully support this idea! Imagine a cave build with whole diamonds just embedded in the walls! I'd go a step further and make blocks like torches and Sea Lanterns should keep their light level in-frame. This could help us incorporate light into builds more attractively.

Better Idea, You should be able to craft an invisible item frame with a potion of invisibility and of corse an item frame. You should not be able to see it unless you click on the [F3] key on your keyboard.

By trading with a Leatherworker on Master Level one could get an invisible item frame.
E.g. by paying 5 Emeralds and a normal item frame.
This would make the Leatherworkers more useful.

That would be amazing!!!! The regular item frames are an eyesore and donâ€™t go well with my new obsession. The nether! If it could just be transparent it would be ok too. Plus in survival we could make it on one of the unused work benches, combine it with a potion or make a frame from glass. Either way a must have for my survival base!!!!

invisible item frames should be crafted by surrounding an item frame with 8 glass panes. When placed the item frame has a visible frame with a glass pane in the middle but when an item is placed in it it will vanish. This will make sure you don't loose it when there's nothing in it.

This would be SO useful for better aesthetics regardless of which mode youâ€™re playing. The ability to dye the item frame in addition to the option to make it invisible would be great as well as it is also the color many times that ruins the aesthetic of what Iâ€™ve put so much time into the rest of. This would be a small but very exciting change for SO much of our community!!
Please add invisible items frames into survival! They enable so many cool building designs!
If there isnâ€™t an item inside of the frame, then you can see it faintly.

Maybe Glass Item Frame?
1 glass plane and 8 stick

or maybe use glass or phantom membrane in crafting recipe? also it could like barriers so if u are holding invisible item frames in ur hand u can see like an outline/ghost of invisible item frames around u
sounds amazing, maybe eveng being able to put several styles into one armor (styles that are compatible of course)

I also had this idea a year ago and i gotta say that those models look amazing. Being able to customize armor sets would make players stand out abit more from eachother rather than everyone wearing the same boring armor models.
Shoulder pads,gem in the chest piece,flippers,horns,gloves,etc.

I have also thought on this a lot.

I'm aware of the upcoming wither flower which can be crafted into black dye, BUT, I think if it is very rare and hard to obtain (which the name suggests) that to better balance the availability of dyes, I propose:

  • charcoal dyes items black, creating the same black dye as the wither flower after mixing it with water, either a water bottle or a water bucket

This option be welcomed by players who don't kill octopi (for moral or other reasons) or don't want to explore the world all the way to end-game (if that is a requisite for the wither flower). It would also bring a new, natural and interesting use to charcoal.

To further lessen the dependency on ink sacs i also suggest

  • coal can be crafted into a writing tool, with a coal and two sticks, one on either side, into a pencil

  • pencils as equivalent to ink and feather for writing books

To motivate using pencils

  • pencils as the required tool for writing on signs, using up the pencil

In this way signs will function similar to books and be used in a more realistic manner. They will still be accessible early game, but spamming them will require more effort.

My friends and I play Minecraft in a Vegetarian/Vegan type style in which we don't kill any mobs that aren't hostile to us. Most dyes are obtainable by flowers, ores, or smelting certain materials with relative ease now, yet black dye is quite difficult (unless you want to kill squids).

Wither Roses add a method of getting black dye that doesn't impose harm on any passive mobs, but like the previous comment states, Wither Roses are very hard to come by. 

I see no issues with allowing Coal and Charcoal to be crafted into Black Dye and would love to see this added to the game.
I can't believe you can build complex redstone but can't craft coal into black dye

If anything, I would much prefer to see concrete stairs and slabs, because I think it would make more sense... concrete is regularly used for stairs and sidewalks in the real world; wool, not so much.

Perhaps, but I still think adding concrete stairs and slabs would be a much better option than adding colored wood planks/stairs/slabs. For me, we have three options concerning colored wooden planks.

1) We add colored variants for all 16 colors, all 6 wood species, and all wood products; this would lead to around 700 new items/blocks, which would be far too many.

2)  We add colored wood, but limit it to only one "wood type", and only add it for the planks, slabs, and stairs. The problem here is that this would go in the opposite direction that I think Mojang wants to go in in terms of game design philosophy. With the recent additions of new buttons, pressure plates, bark blocks, stripped logs, stripped bark, etc. it seems to me that Mojang is working to standardize wood blocks to where each species of wood gets equally represented in an ever-expanding list of wood products. Adding a new class of wood that is implemented only half as much as other types would upset the way things are balanced right now.

3) We let go of the colored wood idea and look for better options, like concrete *hint hint*

I'm not against colored wood in principle, I just think that in order to execute it, we either would have to add a ridiculous amount of new blocks, or implement it in a way that ruins the consistency of the way things are now. That's why I would prefer alternatives.
